alert.note: Alert for St Croix; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 30 at 5:36AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AST THIS MORNING... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, including the following areas, in Puerto Rico, Central Interior, Culebra, Eastern Interior, Mayaguez and Vicinity, North Central, Northeast, Northwest, Ponce and Vicinity, San Juan and Vicinity, Southeast, Southwest, Vieques, and Western Interior. In Virgin Islands, St Croix and St.Thomas...St. John...and Adjacent Islands. * WHEN...Until 8 AM AST this morning * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Based on the most recent guidance, scattered to numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms will continue today across the forecast area. The areas most likely to receive the highest rainfall accumulations are the eastern and southeastern sections of Puerto Rico as well as the US Virgin Islands. In these areas, there will still remain the potential for additional 1-3 inches at least until early Tuesday morning. There is an elevated to significant risk for flooding of urban areas,roads and small streams, especially over the eastern PR, Culebra and isolated areas in the U.S. Virgin Islands. Life threatening flash flooding and mudslides will remain possible as well. Some rivers and stream will likely overflow their banks. As a result the Flash Flood Watch is in effect through at least 8 AM this morning pending additional follow up later in the day based on the conditions and latest model guidance. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
